sense.gloss: means, way, trick, move, technique, workmanship
player (of a sport), athlete, team member
one's own convenience, one's way, selfishness
surroundings, environment, way of doing things
right hand (in archery), hand that pulls the bowstring
unauthorised (e.g. phone app, WWW site), unofficial
skill with one's hands, sleight of hand
force attacking the front of a castle

sdata.j: ↑自分勝手↑↓じぶんがって↓にするつもりはない。
sdata.e: I don't intend to be selfish.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑母↑↓はは↓はあまり↑英語↑↓えいご↓が↑上手↑↓じょうず↓に↑話↑↓はな↓せない。
sdata.e: My mom doesn't speak English very well.

sdata.j: 「↑手伝↑↓てつだ↓ってくれてありがとう」「どういたしまして」
sdata.e: Thank you for helping me. "Don't mention it."

sdata.j: ↑射手↑↓しゃしゅ↓は↑鹿↑↓しか↓を↑射↑↓い↓た。
↑何↑↓なに↓かを↑証明↑↓しょうめい↓しようとする↑場合↑↓ばあい↓、それが↑真実↑↓しんじつ↓であるという↑確信↑↓かくしん↓を↑持↑↓も↓つことは↑何↑↓なん↓らかの↑手助↑↓てだす↓けになる。
sdata.e: When you're trying to prove something, it helps to know it's true.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はピアノを↑上手↑↓じょうず↓に↑弾↑↓ひ↓く。
sdata.e: He plays the piano very well.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はピアノをとても↑上手↑↓じょうず↓に↑弾↑↓ひ↓く。
sdata.e: He plays the piano very well.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はたいへん↑上手↑↓じょうず↓にピアノを↑弾↑↓ひ↓く。
sdata.e: He plays the piano very well.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑六↑↓ろく↓↑歳↑↓さい↓のときタイプライターの↑使↑↓つか↓い↑方↑↓かた↓を↑学↑↓まな↓び、↑手↑↓て↓で↑書↑↓か↓くことを↑学↑↓まな↓ぶ↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓などないと↑先生↑↓せんせい↓に↑言↑↓い↓った。
sdata.e: At the age of six he had learned to use the typewriter and told the teacher that he did not need to learn to write by hand.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓はあなたが↑送↑↓おく↓ってくれた↑手紙↑↓てがみ↓を↑読↑↓よ↓んでいました。
sdata.e: I was rereading the letters you sent to me.

words.gloss: player (of a sport), athlete, team member
